      • getProperty

        public java.lang.String getProperty(java.lang.String propertyPathName)
        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface PropertyGettable<java.lang.String>
        Parameters:
        propertyPathName - "path" to "property" whose value is to be extracted from the context bean which has been set either from the constructor, or via the
        Returns:
        property value

      • getBeanPropertyPath

        public static java.lang.Object getBeanPropertyPath(java.lang.Object bean,
                                                   java.lang.String propertyPathName)
        Parameters:
        bean - java bean from which "property value" is to be extracted
        propertyPathName - "path" to "property" whose value is to be extracted from bean
        Returns:
        object (aka "property") value of the property referenced by propertyPathName, or null if that could not be located / retrieved for any reason
        NOTES:
        1. propertyPathName uses a "dotted" notation to separate components of the "path" to the desired property; e.g., "mybean1.mynestedbean2.myproperty" will return the value of the property "myproperty" from the bean retrieved from the path name "mybean.mynestedbean2".
        2. In the initial implementation, there is no convenient way to distinguish between "normal" an "error" cases when null is returned; however, "WARNING" log message(s) are printed for error cases.
